content: we published our implementation guide ch.fhir.core#1.2.0 and referenced it via our package-feed, simplifer.net picks it up here but in the fhir registry it does not shot the new 1.2.0 version. do we need to something additional or is the update cycle slower?
@Ward Weistra ?

@Oliver Egger Sorry, I missed your question here. It's listed when I check now: https://registry.fhir.org/results?query=%22ch.fhir.ig.ch-core%22.
The script to update the registry.fhir.org Elastic database now runs at least twice a day, so your updates should automatically be reflected.
cc @Grahame Grieve
Some small issues still being worked on :point_down:
@Firely Bot issue show HSCR-1
:warning: Jira returned an error for issue HSCR-1. Use @Firely-Bot issue show ? for more information.
Apparently that board is not public, but: still https://jira.hl7.org/browse/HSCR-1
hi @Ward Weistra thanks for the followup and glad to know the update times for future publications.

@Ward Weistra we have updated on April 24th ch.fhir.ig.ch-core package to version 2.0.0 and announced it in our feed. The package does not show up on registry.fhir.org but does show it on simplifier.net. Is there another process necessary for registry.fhir.org ?
@Oliver Egger :half_frown: I'll look into it

@Oliver Egger It's there now: https://registry.fhir.org/package/ch.fhir.ig.ch-core%7C2.0.0
Reliable automation of it being filled a few times per day is almost there.
thanks a lot @Ward Weistra :+1:

Hi @Oliver Egger, multiple of your packages still have dependencies on dev and current versions of packages, which are labels that can only be used locally:

  • https://simplifier.net/packages/ch.fhir.ig.cda-fhir-maps/0.2.0/files/376812
  • https://simplifier.net/packages/ch.fhir.ig.template/0.6.0/files/375419

Perhaps you can release new versions of them with versioned dependencies. For a little flexibility you are allowed to use an x for the patch version number: https://confluence.hl7.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=35718629#NPMPackageSpecification-Versionreferences

@Ward Weistra thanks for the notice, I hoped we catched all dev / current dependencies, ch.fhir.ig.cda-fhir-maps depends on hl7.fhir.cda, but till now hl7.fhir.cda has (at least to my knowledge) never been publisehd, that's why we refer to dev, @Grahame Grieve do you know if publication of the cda model is on the agenda?

for ch.fhir.ig.template which is the base template for the UI of our swiss ig we are always are working with the lastest hl7 base template, but for sure we can fix them to a specific version and do that with the next publication
@Sean McIlvenna for CDA question. It's getting to be time...
thanks, and i will revist also your comment to the PR in the meantime ...

@Grahame Grieve , time to...??? publish cda-core-2.0? I think we need to allow CDAMG (including @Lisa Nelson) time to vet the state of the logical model before we publish it officially. We worked on some guidance/steps for how they will go about confirming that the cda logical model is correct, but I don't think they've had time to actually do the QA work.

that's why I said 'it's getting to be time', not, 'it is time'. I think it's time to have a roadmap. But also, given @Oliver Egger's considerations, it would be appropriate to publish a draft, to help implementers review, rather than to publish a final
a published draft version for review would be very helpful
